intro: Corydalis incisa, commonly known as the cutleaf larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant has palmately divided leaves that are often deeply lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Corydalis incisa is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
